name: Improved Knockdown or Called Shot under these conditions?
author: Ataxia

posts.author: Ataxia
posts.content:
Hi there!

I have a couple of questions relating to Knockdown, Improved Knockdown and Called Shot. I play on a server which is capped at around level 30 and have figured a melee character build which will have around an AB of 41 - 43 depending on if i'm dual wielding or carrying a shield.

I expect to be facing opponents in pvp which will have mostly +4 gear with some having +5 items at a level cap of 30. Furthermore, I know with some certainty that greater gloves of swordplay (+30 discipline) are available as rare loot and also that it will not be difficult to add +12 to base strength through equipment. Naturally, there are likely to be many characters who aren't packing these items, but I'm considering the worst case scenario.

So, all being considered; would you guys considered knockdown, improved knockdown or indeed called shot? I have two pre-epic feats spare in my build and would really like to hear the relative merits of each of them.

Thanks in advance,

- Ataxia

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
I would advise you to go for Knockdown and Improved Knockdown in this case. Called Shot effects don't disable opponents, and IKD will always be useful against casters. If you are a Monk meleer, however, Called Shot will stack up impressively with the attack schedule and 7 attacks per round. In that case, Knockdown and Improved Knockdown will come free, so you can grab Called Shot instead.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Ataxia
posts.content:
I didn't consider the caster angle; but it makes a lot of sense. Especially as the buildwill be packing crippling strike and a few d6 of sneak attacks.

Seems like a no brainer to take KD and imp KD when you factor the sneaks into it doesn't it?

Cheers fella.

-Ataxia
